title: Disney On Ice UK tour set to return in spring 2020 and tickets are on sale now
text:

A brand new Disney on Ice tour will be heading to the UK next spring.

The tour will feature popular Disney characters from past and present films, who will be taking to the ice in a completely new choreographed show for 2020.

The new show is set to kick off in Liverpool in March and end in Birmingham in May.

Tickets are on sale now, priced from £25, and can be bought online from Ticketmaster and other major ticket outlets as well as directly from the Disney website.

The family-friendly show is a perfect day out for kids of all ages, with performances from all their favourite characters including Moana, Frozen's Anna and Elsa and The Little Mermaid's Sebastian and Ariel.

Disney On Ice presents Magical Ice Festival tour dates

(Image: Disney on Ice)

The news comes as the current Disney on Ice 100 Years of Magic tour kicks off across the UK.

The tour, which began this week in Birmingham, pays homage to the legacy of Walt Disney and will come to an end at London's O2 Arena on 5 January.

There are still tickets available from Ticketmaster and StubHub for selected dates across the UK if you're thinking about booking a family day out over the half term or festive season.

Speaking about the 100 Years of Magic tour ahead of its launch, producer Nicole Feld said: “This particular production is by far the largest Disney On Ice show we currently have touring bringing together everyone’s favourite Disney characters from Snow White, Mickey Mouse and Minnie Mouse to Elsa and Anna.

“Our vision is for audiences everywhere to dance and sing along to their favourite Disney songs, so we’ve included 30 tunes that they know and love.”
